title: How to Get a Pumpkin Stain Out of Black Cotton

steps.headline: Clean off any big pumpkin pieces from the garment or fabric.
Put pre-treatment on the garment or fabric.
Rub the treatment into the stained part of the garment.
Soak the garment in the stain pre-treatment.
Scrub it with a scrubbing brush.
steps.description: Make sure that the brush is strong enough to remove stains but gentle enough not to rip the garment or fabric.

steps.headline: Add some detergent as well and continue scrubbing at the garment or fabric.
Blot some rubbing alcohol on the stain if there are still stains left after washing, then wash it out.
Use white vinegar if this hasn't worked, then put the garment through another full washing cycle.
The shirt should be stain free again.

text: Pre-treatment Clean off any big pumpkin pieces from the garment or fabric.  Put pre-treatment on the garment or fabric.  Rub the treatment into the stained part of the garment.  Soak the garment in the stain pre-treatment.  Scrub it with a scrubbing brush. Make sure that the brush is strong enough to remove stains but gentle enough not to rip the garment or fabric. Add some detergent as well and continue scrubbing at the garment or fabric.  Treating stubborn stains Blot some rubbing alcohol on the stain if there are still stains left after washing, then wash it out.  Use white vinegar if this hasn't worked, then put the garment through another full washing cycle.  The shirt should be stain free again.
